intro: Lobivia pugionacantha, commonly known as the sharp-tipped lobivia, is a compact, branching cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It features short, cylindrical stems that are typically covered in a layer of white, powdery wax, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, adding a striking contrast to its green foliage. Its leaves are modified into spines, providing protection from herbivores and reducing transpiration. Lobivia pugionacantha is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and drought tolerance.
